benchmark_details.name: Human Confusion Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The Human Confusion Dataset is introduced to study dual thinking and logical processing in human vision, providing a range of confusing images that reveal insights into the dual processing framework in human visual perception.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for analyzing human visual processing and evaluating deep learning models on cognitively challenging images.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset requires models to rely on cues that are not commonly encountered, requiring specific solutions tailored to their respective environments.

data.source: Crowd-sourced using Amazon Turk and contributions from additional participants.
data.annotation: Annotated based on Gestalt principles and logical errors.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated by comparing model outputs against human annotations and assessing the correctness of intuitive and actual perceptions.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted based on the alignment of model outputs with human intuitive perceptions.
methodology.validation: Validated through human perception verification and comparison with model outputs.
